title: FOMO trust indicator + lightweight live social-proof popups on landing page

requirements.summary: Add an above-the-fold highlighted FOMO trust indicator directly under the hero RegistrationForm CTA button.
acceptanceCriteria: On the landing page hero section, directly under the RegistrationForm submit button (‚ÄúRegister Now for Free‚Äù), a centered highlighted line is rendered with the exact text: ‚Äúüî• 3,000+ students have already registered‚Äù.
The trust indicator is visible without scrolling on common mobile and desktop viewports (above the fold).
The trust indicator uses a soft contrasting background (light yellow or light green) and a subtle leading icon (üî• or üë•).
The trust indicator font size is visibly smaller than the CTA button text.
No backend changes are required for this trust indicator.

file_operations.description: Render a centered, slightly-smaller-than-CTA highlighted trust-indicator line immediately below the submit button with the exact text ‚Äúüî• 3,000+ students have already registered‚Äù, using a soft contrasting background (light yellow or light green) and subtle styling to keep it above-the-fold in the hero form.

requirements.summary: Implement a lightweight bottom-left live social-proof popup that periodically shows one modern notification card with animation.
acceptanceCriteria: A notification card appears in the bottom-left corner of the landing page and displays exactly: ‚Äú{Name} from {City} registered {TimeAgo}‚Äù.
Only one popup is visible at a time.
Popups appear on a random interval between 6 and 10 seconds (inclusive) and auto-hide after ~4 seconds.
The popup uses a smooth fade-in + slide-up animation on show and a smooth fade-out (no abrupt removal).
The notification card design is clean and modern with: white background, soft shadow, rounded corners, and a small green dot/tick icon on the left.
The popup is responsive and does not block critical UI on mobile (including the registration CTA).
Implementation is lightweight and does not add heavy external libraries.

file_operations.description: Create a lightweight React component that renders a single fixed bottom-left notification card at a time with a small green tick/dot icon on the left (reuse existing icon set), clean modern card styling (white background, soft shadow, rounded corners), and smooth show/hide animations (fade + slide). Ensure mobile responsiveness so it avoids blocking critical UI.
Wire the SocialProofPopups component into the landing page so it runs on this page and displays in the bottom-left while keeping existing content/registration flow unchanged.

Add/extend lightweight animation utilities (keyframes/animations or rely on transitions) used by the SocialProofPopups notification card for smooth fade-in + slide-up and fade-out behaviors without introducing heavy external libraries.

requirements.summary: Add per-visitor non-repeating name rotation with shuffle-on-load, storage persistence, and configurable constants for the social-proof popups.
acceptanceCriteria: For a given browser visitor, the system never shows the same name twice across popups until the provided names list is exhausted.

The system stores shown-name state in sessionStorage or localStorage so that refreshing the page does not cause already-shown names to reappear during the same visitor‚Äôs stored session/history (depending on the chosen storage).
The names list is shuffled on initial load before selection begins (not displayed alphabetically).
The system stops scheduling new popups after all unique names from the provided list have been used; it does not loop/restart names.
Cities are chosen randomly from the provided cities list and may repeat even when names cannot repeat.
All lists and timing parameters are defined in a clearly editable place (e.g., constants/config) rather than being scattered through component logic.

file_operations.description: Define clearly editable constants/config for the social-proof system: predefined Indian names list, Indian cities list, time-ago options, show interval range (6‚Äì10s), and auto-hide duration (~4s), plus a storage key and a switch for sessionStorage vs localStorage.

Implement lightweight helpers for shuffling names on initial load, selecting names without replacement, persisting shown names in web storage, and determining when all names are exhausted (so scheduling stops). Keep logic framework-agnostic and easy to adjust.

Use the socialProofConfig and socialProofState helpers to: shuffle names on mount, pick names without replacement, persist shown names per visitor using sessionStorage or localStorage, allow cities to repeat, rotate time-ago strings, and stop creating new popups once all names are used. Ensure timing uses a random interval between 6‚Äì10 seconds and auto-hides after ~4 seconds with a non-abrupt fade-out.
